title: Ladbrokes owner GVC lifts profit guidance despite high street slump
text:
Ladbrokes and Gala Coral owner GVC will make more profit than expected this year despite an ongoing slump in its UK shops.

Like-for-like sales fell 18pc in the three months to September, which the company blamed on a cut in the maximum stake at fixed odds betting machines in April from £100 to £2.

However, the industry has also been hit by the decline of the high street and the rise of online and app-based betting. GVC confirmed it still expects to close 900 shops in the next two years.

Despite 12pc growth in online sales, overall revenue for the period fell 1pc.
